snippet: The state’s Senate approved a bill that would force schools to notify parents if their children will be assigned to read books with sexually explicit content.
abstract: Republican-controlled Senate in Virginia approves bill that would force schools to notify parents of sexually explicit content in books assigned to their children; opponents view bill as first step towards censorship.
lead_paragraph: The state’s Senate approved a bill that would force schools to notify parents if their children will be assigned to read books with sexually explicit content.

headline.main: Virginia: Bill to Notify Parents of Books’ Content Advances
headline.print_headline: Virginia: Bill to Notify Parents of Books’ Content Advances
